statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Harvard 69, Columbia 64
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Jim Goffredo scored 22 points and Matt Stehle added 16 as Harvard ended an eight-game losing streak with a 69-64 win over Columbia on Saturday night. Goffredo, who had 14 points in the second half, scored five straight to break a 42-42 tie midway through the second half and give the Crimson (13-14, 5-9 Ivy League) the lead for good. Goffredo's fadeaway baseline jumper made it 44-42 with 9:11 remaining. He hit a 3-pointer on the Crimson's next possession to make it 47-42. Columbia (11-16, 4-10) pulled within two points three times but never got any closer. After John Baumann cut the deficit to 51-49 with 5:56 remaining, Goffredo put Harvard up by five again with another 3-pointer. He later extended Harvard's lead to 64-54 with his fifth 3 of the game. Goffredo was 7-of-13 shooting, including 5-of-9 from the 3-point line. Justin Armstrong and Ben Nwachukwu each scored 13 for Columbia, which ended the season with three straight losses. Armstrong had a game-high 10 rebounds. Harvard led 37-27 at halftime, but Columbia opened the second half on a 14-2 run. After Baumann's layup tied it at 39 with 14:10 remaining, Dragutin Kravic gave the Lions their first lead since the opening minutes.
